diagnoses.description: Acute transmural myocardial infarction of anterior wall

encounters.reason: Severe chest pain, radiating to left arm, shortness of breath

encounters.description: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention with stent placement

encounters.notes: Patient stable, no recurrent chest pain, monitoring continues
Vitals stable, patient reports feeling better, troponin levels decreasing
Significant improvement, discussing discharge plans and rehabilitation
Discharge instructions given, medications prescribed, follow-up scheduled

med_orders.frequency: Every 5 minutes PRN for chest pain

follow_up_care.details: Follow-up appointment scheduled for 2024-03-20 to assess recovery and medication management.

lifestyle_modifications.details: Adopt a heart-healthy diet low in saturated fats, cholesterol, and sodium. Increase intake of fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
Gradual reintroduction of physical activity, starting with light walking. Aim to build up to at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity per week.
Immediate cessation of smoking. Consider nicotine replacement therapy and counseling to support quitting.
Explore stress-reducing activities and techniques such as mindfulness, yoga, or meditation. Consider professional support if needed.

notes.note: Patient admitted and PCI performed. Stable after procedure.
No recurrent chest pain. Vitals stable. Continue monitoring.
Patient reports feeling better. Pain management effective. Troponin levels decreasing.
Stable vitals. Patient in good spirits. No complications noted.
Significant improvement. Planning for rehabilitation and discharge.
Discharge planning continues. Patient educated on medication regimen.
Pre-discharge checks. All medications reviewed. Patient ready for discharge tomorrow.
Discharge process initiated. Final checks and education completed.
